creator: eduardo.pelegrillopart@sun.com
text:
The JSP specification allows for a custom action to be declared to always have 
an empty body.  This can be used to generate better code on the calling site 
since it means that some portions of the protocol will never be used.

There is code in Jasper that is trying to do this, but there seems to be a bug 
that is disabling the code.

The bug seems to be at line 845, in Parser.java, where "true" is passed into the 
hasBody attribute of listener.handleTagBegin (and handleTagEnd).

    - eduard/o
